meanings.definition: A chemical compound used in biological staining techniques to detect living cells.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used tetrazolium to find out which cells were alive.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician added tetrazolium to the sample to see if any cells were still active.
meanings.sent3: The tetrazolium seemed to have a magical power to reveal the living cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The tetrazolium acted like a detective, uncovering the secrets of the living cells.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the tetrazolium made the living cells stand out clearly.

meanings.definition: A type of redox indicator used in biochemical assays.
meanings.sent1: The scientist added tetrazolium to the solution to measure the redox reaction.
meanings.sent2: The lab equipment included tetrazolium for detecting changes in the biochemical process.
meanings.sent3: The tetrazolium in the test tube seemed to glow with excitement as the reaction took place.
meanings.sent4: The tetrazolium functioned like a traffic light, signaling the progress of the biochemical reaction.
meanings.sent5: The color change of the tetrazolium indicated the shift in the redox state of the solution.

meanings.definition: A class of organic compounds containing a tetrazole ring structure.
meanings.sent1: The textbook explained the properties of tetrazolium compounds with ring structures.
meanings.sent2: Chemists study the characteristics of tetrazolium compounds due to their unique ring shape.
meanings.sent3: The tetrazolium molecules in the beaker seemed to dance around in their ring formation.
meanings.sent4: The tetrazolium rings intertwined like a complex puzzle, revealing their intricate nature.
meanings.sent5: The structure of the tetrazolium ring resembled a tiny, molecular carousel.
